title: Survey Reveals Consumers Prioritize Purchasing Sustainable Products and Desire Greater Transparency from ... - PR Newswire
summary: Consumers prefer sustainable products and packaging, desire transparency from companies regarding sustainability, and are willing to pay more for sustainable options. Companies need to back up sustainability claims with data and provide recycling information on products. Consumers plan to make more sustainable purchasing decisions in 2024.

title: Capture or reuse CO2 as a chemical source for the production of sustainable plastics - EurekAlert
summary: Researchers have developed a new technique using CO2 to create easily recyclable polyurethane plastics, offering a sustainable solution for the mass production of plastics and the need for recycling. The innovative technology allows for the use of waste CO2 as a raw material, resulting in plastics that can be recycled multiple ways, thus contributing to environmental sustainability.
green_innovation: TRUE - The development of a new technique using CO2 to create easily recyclable plastics aligns with environmental sustainability goals by reducing the environmental impact of plastic production and promoting recycling, making it a green innovation.
business_innovation: FALSE - The article focuses on the development of a new production technique for polyurethane plastics with environmental benefits but does not specifically relate to a new product or business process introduced on the market, therefore not meeting the definition of a business innovation.
green_product: TRUE - The article discusses the creation of polyurethane plastics designed for easy recycling, significantly reducing their environmental impact throughout their life cycle. These plastics promote recycling, the use of waste CO2 as a raw material, and sustainable production processes, aligning with the definition of a green product.
green_process: TRUE - The article describes a new method for producing polyurethane plastics that minimizes environmental impacts by using waste CO2 as a raw material, promoting sustainability, recycling, and reducing harmful substances. This innovative process aligns with the definition of a green process.
likely_naics_codes: Likely NAICS Codes: 325211 - Plastics Material and Resin Manufacturing, 32522 - Artificial and Synthetic Fibers and Filaments Manufacturing, 325 - Chemical Manufacturing, 562 - Waste Management and Remediation Services
greenwashing: FALSE - The article highlights a genuine innovation in polyurethane production using CO2 to create easily recyclable plastics, without any indication of misleading or false environmental claims, making it a genuine green innovation.
